Description: an ID is repeated more than once inside a single cell
the same bibliographic entity is found in both citing_id and cited_id of the same row
the same citation (= the fact that a bibliographic entity cites another bibliograhic entity) is found in more than one row
inside the id field, spaces are found at the beginning of the string or at the end, or extra spaces are found between two single ids

Error: wrong syntax for an ID of a Bibliographic Resource
Description: the single id (item) is not well-formed according to OC syntax (lowercase accepted prefix followed by colon and other non-space characters)
the value of a mandatory field (either citing_id or cited_id) is an empty string
the date is badly formatted (does not match the one regex that defines any correct possibility)
the characters of the title string are all uppercase
any format error in 'author' or 'editor'
notes: The same as for publisher (wellformedness_publisher_item), but here only one comma is legal outside brackets

Description: any format error in 'publisher'
notes: The same as for author and editor (wellformedness_people_item), but here more than one comma is legal outside brackets

Description: a string likely to be a R.A. ID or a sequence of such is found NOT enclosed in brackets
the same bibliographic entity is represented in more than one row
any format error in 'venue'
a string likely to be an ID for a venue or a sequence of such is found NOT enclosed in brackets
any format error in 'volume' or 'issue'
any format error in 'page' field
the interval in 'page' is invalid or it is impossible to convert it into integer numbers
any format error in 'type'
one or more required values for certain fields are not specified in the row, OR the specified values in 'type' are incorrect (only for row with specified 'volume' or 'issue')
notes: discuss w/ Arcangelo for needed amendments in META-CSV syntax definition

Description: error in the externally-defined syntax of the identifier for a BR
the ID  of the BR is not registered in the service accessed via API
error in the externally-defined syntax of the identifier for a RA
the ID  of the RA is not registered in the service accessed via API
the ID of the BR is not compatible with the value of the 'type' field according to OCDM
